location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: One page from a mounted and bound volume of twenty-five pen-and-ink wash drawings, and two pen-and-ink maps of Nashville created by William A. Eichbaum during the 1850s. Eichbaum was a Nashville bookseller and resident for fifty years. The fruit painting on this page was painted by Eichbaum's wife, Catherine Stearns. Stearns was a teacher at the Nashville Female Academy. The painting was found loose inside the bound volume of Eichbaum's sketches. Forms part of the Eichbaum Sketchbook Collection. 1 painting : col. ; 5.75 x 9 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission. Please contact the Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219. Telephone (615) 862-5782.
